intro: Persicaria mesochora, commonly known as water pepper, is a herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy environments. It features erect, branched stems that are often hairy and can grow up to 1 meter in height. The leaves are lance-shaped, with a rough texture and a distinctive reddish or purple underside. Small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in clusters at the tips of the stems, and the plant produces small, round seeds that are dispersed by wind. It is often used in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory properties.
